host.host_about:
Our names are Matthew and Danielle and we moved to this beautiful Hawaiian island over six years ago.  We count our sea-change to Hawaii as one of the best things we ever did and we absolutely love this place!  Surrounded by wild beauty, turquoise waters, bright sunshine, friendly towns, pristine beaches, epic sunsets, gleaming waterfalls, warm water, lush mountain ranges, and the sound of tropical breezes rustling through the palm trees, how could we not?
Matt and I have been married for almost 13 years and have two sons:  Ryker, who is at the very fun, adventurous age of 4, and Finn who is at the loveable age of 2.5. We also have high hopes to add more kiddos sometime in the future.  
A little about us:  we LOVE Hawaii.  The beach is our favorite playground; building sandcastles with the boys, surfing, cruising on our SUP boards, joy-riding waves to shore, exploring the underwater world with mask and snorkel, kayaking, hiking- we just can’t get enough.  
Feel free to contact us with any questions:
 (Email hidden by Airbnb) 

Blessings!

reviews.comments: Look no further. This is the place for you! Seriously. Perfect location, amazing hosts, beautiful comfy home. Everything you need! I would have stayed forever if I could.

Great stylish beach home with modern amenities and furnishing. Very comfortable home right on the canal which we loved kayaking down. The beach toys, umbrella etc made our time at the beach much more enjoyable. Danielle and Matt were lovely hosts too!
Lovely apartment, stunning views!

Many thanks to Danielle and Matt for being amazing and accommodating hosts. The space was modern yet cozy and comfortable. We really enjoyed staying in a quieter area with access to water activities in our backyard. Lots of food and shopping options down the street. I'd definitely recommend this place and would stay here again if given the chance.

What an amazing find! Not only is the location fanstatic (close to beautiful beaches, grocery stores, and easy highway access) but the place was immaculately clean! Seriously, better than 4 star hotels I've stayed in. Matthew and Danielle are gracious hosts and if you have any issues will reply immediately and it fix it. There is also a binder with helpful hints, favorite beaches and shopping locations which helped us out a lot. Check out the night market for some tasty street food, and The Windward Mall on Sat AM's for local food and wares. We loved staying here and you will too!

We absolutely love Danielle’s place, definitely exceeds our expectation! Best experience hands down. The place looks even better in person. It’s well stocked, clean, comfy, cozy with tasteful decor! Love the location as it’s close to hwy, beaches, grocery, and local eateries. Will miss waking up to that beautiful view of the canal every morning! Danielle is super kind and helpful and always speedy with responses whenever we have questions. 
Thank you for a wonderful stay!!

Everything was as advertised or better than described. I stayed here on the company dime this trip and intend to spend my own money to stay here when I bring the family for vacation if the scheduling works out.

Not often I give all five stars, but everything was first class across the board. The hosts are fantastic, very friendly, always willing to help. The place was much nicer than expected - clean, modern, and new. Lots of room for our 4 adults and would easily accommodate 6. Great location near a beach town. Lovely view of the canal from lanai, close proximity to a fantastic local beach, as well as lots of nearby restaurants 5 minutes into Kailua. Highly recommended for a relaxing Hawaiian vacay.
Great hospitality and the accommodations we thought would be great were better than we anticipated.
Really enjoyed our stay at Danielle's place. Very clean, comfortable and modern place that we all enjoyed.  She has all the amenities needed plus a lot of nice extras.  I highly recommend her place.

Danielle's place is beautiful, clean, spacious, and perfectly located! We were there for work (unfortunately) so didn't get to enjoy everything that they had to offer, but we still really enjoyed our stay there. Had we had more time we would have loved to use the kayaks or paddle boards they have available to explore the canal that's right in the backyard! We got to meet Danielle and she graciously let us take over some of the shared space with all of our research gear for a few days, which really made things easy for us. She told us to let her know if we needed anything, but we never had to ask since they thought of and had pretty much everything we needed (including coffee for the coffee maker!) We'll definitely be looking to stay there next time we head down! I highly recommend Danielle's place!

When we first stumbled upon this  AirBnB, it seemed almost too good to be true. There must be a catch! But everything was as perfect as it seemed online. This space was perfectly located near great shops, restaurants and bars. Her place was clean, well designed and spacious- thoughtful, sweet touches…..quiet and super clean. Absolutely loved it! Danielle was communicative and supremely helpful in giving advice for places to go.  She was the most thoughtful, gracious host. We wouldn’t hesitate to stay at Danielle's home again. Mahalo Danielle and Ohana!
Great place in a beautiful spot!

Beautiful, spacious and super clean space.  Peaceful with a fantastic view.  One of the nicest Airbnb’s we’ve stayed in.  Danielle and Matthew were great hosts, very responsive and thoughtful.  Highly recommend.
Expect more than what you read and see in the pictures!! Perfect location to get to everything! Would stay here every time in Oahu!!

This unit is as wonderful as the pictures show and Danielle and Matt are very gracious and friendly. Danielle kept asking if we needed anything, and was very responsive to requests. Our family of 5 adults stayed 9 nights in January and we never needed the ACs because of the fans and the breezes, and the roof fan in the living room quickly pulled out hot air in the late afternoon. My parents loved doing tai chi on the balcony overlooking the canal, and my husband and I enjoyed the easy kayaking out to the ocean & back. The unit is a very short drive to stores and nearby beaches, but it's not walkable to the beach and parking is difficult at Kailua beaches on weekends or during high season. One thing that was not a big deal for us but might be for others, is that there was no door between the master bathroom and master bedroom (at least during our stay). Also, the kitchen is stocked with many things for cooking, but not as much as other units of this size (e.g., not as many pans and cooking utensils), but Danielle lent us a few things. Everything is super clean, the beds are very comfortable with lots of fluffy pillows, and everything works or is brand new.

Enough space for 6 of us, close to the one of the most beautiful beaches in Hawaii, 5 min drive to Target and other shops and restaurants in Kailua, a well-equipped kitchen, a gorgeous view of canal, a quiet and safe neighborhood. 
What else do you need?
Good location. Spacious accommodation, kitchen is well stocked . Great view off the living room balcony

name: Room king hostel
summary: The house is located on the boulevard with a well-developed infostructure, just 5 minutes from Monk metro station, restaurants, restaurants, shops, direct bus to the city center (10-15 minutes)
description: The house is located on the boulevard with a well-developed infostructure, just 5 minutes from Monk metro station, restaurants, restaurants, shops, direct bus to the city center (10-15 minutes) Free breakfast up to 5 days stay! Every Sunday you are waited by the general breakfast of various desserts (regardless of the number of days of stay)
notes: Free breakfast up to 5 days stay! Every Sunday you are waited by the general breakfast of various desserts (regardless of the number of days of stay)
house_rules: do not make noise after 22, children can live in the house!

reviews.comments: Daria and King are a nice and helpful hosts with great communication skills.
Awesum. Great place. Outstanding ambience.

we had a great stay at this hostel. the hospitality of our hosts was great. when there was a parade at the street, they called us to par our car somewhere else, so it wont be towed away. after running back to the hostel they also gave us some bottled water on our way, which was really nice.
the metro is in walking distance, so you can reach downtown very quickly.
Nice place to stay
A good place to just sleep

name: Kailua Blue Ocean Breeze/Across Beach
space: WElCOME TO PARADISE!  Kailua is one of the most sought after vacation destinations in Oahu.  Kailua is located on the Windward  side of Oahu just 12 miles northeast of Honolulu - over Nu'uanu Pali, tallest mountain peak in the Ko'olau mountain range.  Kailua offers picturesque, uncrowded beaches, great restaurants, and wonderful people within the backdrop of a small, laid back community. This is a perfect place for you to relax in comfort and enjoy all that the island has to offer. Our home is a beautiful, bright new 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom furnished home, fenced yard, garden and pool.  The bathroom is shared with other guests and is cleaned daily.  Our home has many amenities including an outside shower for you to rinse off after a long day at the beach. Get away from the bustle of Waikiki and picnic at the beach in Kailua Beach Park offering a half mile of soft white sand, turquoise water and gentle breezes.  Kailua Beach is a hub for water sports.  Kailua Beach welcomes visitors and l
description: WElCOME TO PARADISE!  Kailua is one of the most sought after vacation destinations in Oahu.  Kailua is located on the Windward  side of Oahu just 12 miles northeast of Honolulu - over Nu'uanu Pali, tallest mountain peak in the Ko'olau mountain range.  Kailua offers picturesque, uncrowded beaches, great restaurants, and wonderful people within the backdrop of a small, laid back community. This is a perfect place for you to relax in comfort and enjoy all that the island has to offer. Our home is a beautiful, bright new 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom furnished home, fenced yard, garden and pool.  The bathroom is shared with other guests and is cleaned daily.  Our home has many amenities including an outside shower for you to rinse off after a long day at the beach. Get away from the bustle of Waikiki and picnic at the beach in Kailua Beach Park offering a half mile of soft white sand, turquoise water and gentle breezes.  Kailua Beach is a hub for water sports.  Kailua Beach welcomes visitors and l
notes: ABOUT PAYMENT:  Many ask about the price and extra fees and how to pay. When you put in the dates and number of people you will get our total cost. There are no taxes on top of this, but AirBnB adds their fee. It varies between 6-12% on top of our price. All the payments are safely made with credit card to AirBnB when booking. They hold the money until the day you check in and will then transfer it to us. Bookings with us are done with the "strict" cancellation policy and all cancellations should be done through AirBnB.
access: The home is a shared space with our family. You will have a private bathroom that is not shared. There is a refrigerator in your room for food storage.  You are welcome to use the kitchen table, lanai table and living room for eating.  We do not share the stove top for cooking, but you are welcome to use the microwave to heat up your food.
interaction: We are always available if you need local advice, or any travel tips.  If we are busy at home, please text us or send us a message via airbnb and we will be happy to get back to as soon as possible.  Every airbnb guest is different.  We want to serve you and will be respectful of your privacy.  We will judge our level of interaction with you based on your request.
house_rules: ALOHA, Welcome to Kailua Blue Ocean Breeze.  We are very happy to have the opportunity to share these moments in paradise with you. We have a few important details which we would like you to review that will assist in making sure your days are harmonious. 1.  Please use the towel rack behind the bed room door to dry your towels.  Please do not leave your towels on top of the bed when they are wet.  2.  To respect all guests, please take your towel with you to your bedroom. 3.  You are welcome to use the kitchen and the dining room for small quick meals. Please make sure to wash and dry your plates and utensils after each use.  4.  In Hawaii it is tradition to take off your shoes at the entrance of the home as it is the belief that the shoes will bring energy from the street into the home. 5.When you go to the beach, please enter along the lateral side of house with the gate.  Behind our house, you will find a hose where you can rinse off. 6.  Please keep music and noise to a minimum be

host.host_about: We are an adventurous family that enjoys meeting others, travelling to new destinations and learning from each experience we encounter.  We enjoy surfing, hiking, mountain biking, climbing, Jiu-Jitsu and spending time with family and friends.

reviews.comments: What fabulous accommodations!  Our host were amazing and welcomed us with such aloha from the start.  My husband, son (8mth) and I felt right and home.  They went above and beyond to provide us comfort throughout our stay; insomuch that we rebooked additional nights to end our trip at their home once again.  We took a hike with their family, which was wonderful and they graciously provided us an infant bed and accessories and more.  With such private accommodations you would never know you were actually under the same roof.  We would highly recommend the Kaneohe Mountain Side Home especially if the sounds of streaming water are soothing to you (itʻs a beautiful and peaceful way to fall asleep and awake each day).  We would also love to stay again in the future...thanks so much for all the hospitality!  Victor, Kanoelani & Makoaheʻenalu

We had the best time with Melissa and her warm-hearted family over New Year's. THANK YOU so much! The location is ideal to go out and explore the entire island, even though we also greatly enjoyed spending time at the lovely accommodation. We would like to come back anytime!

We loved our stay with this great family!  They were so welcoming, they made us feel right at home.  Our children had a wonderful time playing with their son and his toys:)  They fed us and shared many other things including an afternoon of hiking in the mountains.  We loved our room, two sides of it being windows it was wonderful to hear all the birds, the brook and Mr. Toad:)  We would defiantly stay here again!

Melissa, Cabral and little Kawe were perfect hosts. Cabral made coffee every morning and little, very cute and well behaved Kawe. kept us company during breakfast. Melissa gave us some helpful recommendations - Sunset Beach , Pu'u o Mahuka Heiau, a little shrimp truck - snce we have had only two days on Oah'u, it was very nice. The room was spotless, so was the kitchen and the bathroom. Location was good too - close to beautiful North Shore and not too far from Honolulu and other interesting sites. We were able to see a lot during our shore, but very pleasant, stay with Melissa and her family.

Staying with Melissa, Cabral and Kaue was great! They were incredibly welcoming and very helpful with answering questions and giving tips about places to go and things to check out. Melissa even offered us some chocolate cake she made for Valentine's Day when we arrived! I felt like I was at home here.

I greaty enjoyed my stay with Melissa, Cabral, and Kaue. They made me feel right at home. As it was my first time in Oahu, they gave me great recommendations for places to check out that were off the beaten path. The location of their house is ideal as it's just a short drive to most of the sights and locations. I'd definitely recommend staying with them.

Our stay with Melissa, Cabral and Kaue was absolutely amazing.  Every morning when we would wake up and head to the kitchen, Cabral would be making us coffee, Melissa would offer us fresh baked muffins (on her day off)  and their adorable son Kaue would give us nothing but smiles and laughter!  Great way to start any morning.  Your room is secluded from the rest of the house, so it's very private, however at the same time, you get to enjoy this great family's company in the common area when you head to the kitchen.  We had full use of their fridge and kitchen.  They had no qualms about us getting home late, as we were very respectable and quiet, as I would hope anyone who stays here would be.  We are extremely grateful for all that they did for us during our stay, and also blessed to have met such a great family.  Everyday they would say, "Make yourself at home" or "My home is your home".  We stayed with this wonderful family for 14 days while we searching for permanently living on Oahu, as we relocated and didn't want to jump into anything too quickly.  They offered great advice about what the island had to offer, as well as restaurants to go to for dinner.  We are very happy to have met them, and look forward to many more adventures with this "AWESOME" family!

Robin and I spent the last 3 nights of an exhausting one months vacation with Melissa and her family. We wished we could have had more time to enjoy the peace and quiet of their tranquil environment. The accommodation provided was extremely comfortable and clean, and to go to sleep listening to the sound of the babbling stream was exquisite.  We will certainly be back on our next trip to O'ahu,  thank you for everything!  It was an amazing end to our (Website hidden by Airbnb)  J
a lovely family- we would spend of course the next time at this place -
Melissa & family were excellent hosts.  Bedroom clean, bright & right along a babbling brook.  Awesome homemade banana bread & recommendations for daily activities.
Melissa and Gabral are amazing hosts! They gave great advice where to go based on our interests. It is a really nice place to stay.

Melissa and Cabral were awesome hosts. They told me their home was my home, and they meant it! They offered me food and drinks all the time and Cabral made me awesome avocado smoothies. They gave me tips on what to do on (the windward side of) Oahu and even drove me to bus stops that were more convenient
Their son Kawe is very cute and I also met Melissa's mother who is a wonderful person!

The room was beatiful and clean, the bed was comfortable and you could hear a small river behind the house which was very soothing. The place in general is very bright and nicely decorated. It is surrounded by impressive mountains, definitely a must-see.

The location is perfect for exploring the windward side, the north shore etc. It is only a short drive from the beautiful beaches of Kailua and Lanikai and you can reach those destinations by bus as well. In the area there are some great hiking paths (Hauula Loop for example).

Melissa and Cabral went out of their way to make my stay memorable. I highly recommend staying with them!

P.S. They even send me my flip-flops, which I forgot at their place, to California!

We felt like guests during the entire stay with Melissa and Cabral.  Our hosts were very generous and provided us morning coffee and fresh picked fruit.  The space is clean and accurate per the photos provided.  You literally do go to sleep to the sound of a creek and wake up to birds chirping.  Melissa and Cabral are active/outdoorsy and can give good traveling tips both on and off the beaten path.

Melissa & Cabral are very gracious hosts and are very accommodating.  They picked me up at the airport (super helpful), and made sure I was well while I searched for housing on the windward side.  They are happy to answer questions and treat you as a (temporary) member of the family.

Absolutely wonderful people in a small residential area that is about 20 minutes from very nice beaches (e.g., Lanikai) and 30 min to an hour to north shore. The area is up against a pretty mountain and the creek and bird sounds make for great sleeping. While the house is small for the number of residents (Mellissa, Cabral, their cute 2 year old and a newborn baby), they made such an effort so that we had complete access to the shared bathroom. Kitchen and common area were a bit tricky due to the number of adults and children in the house. We (a couple) traveled with a 9 month old baby. We were housebound during the evenings (after putting the baby to sleep), but could not stay in our room (for fear of waking the our baby). Kitchen is more or less a one person kitchen but again Melissa and Cabral arranged so that we could cook whenever we wanted.

They say that traveling is not just about where you go or where you stay, but the people that you encounter along the way. Melissa and Cabral are two such individuals who will increase your appreciation for the location. They are very kind and were willing to help us whenever we requested assistance. Additionally, they took us into their family as if we were one of their own. This was greatly appreciated and we enjoyed the unique local perspective that this offered on the island.

You won't find a cleaner, warmer more charming place on the island. The icing on the cake were the hosts! They are the most authentic, gracious and beautiful couple in the world. The only thing cuter than them were their two precious kids.

There is only one choice for me when I come to Oahu...hang out at the sanctuary, also known as Kailua Blue Ocean Breeze.

Mahalo, Melissa and Frank!

Melissa and Carbal were great.  They were like my family and the house is beautiful and very spacious.  Additionally, they are located just minutes from Kailua town.  Melissa and Cabral were willing to help me with whatever I needed.  I would highly recommend their home to anyone looking for a relaxing vacation.

My stay with Melissa and Cabral was very nice, and their place was clean, modern, and comfortable.  It was so relaxing and convenient to be so close to town and the beautiful beach as well.  Both Melissa and Cabral were so friendly and wanting my stay to be as easy for me as possible and it was nice having them as hosts!  I would definitely recommend their place to anyone I know.

ﾒﾘｯｻとﾌﾗﾝｸ､二人のﾍﾞﾋﾞｰとの時間は､僕が旅を始めてから､家族を持ってみんなで旅を楽しむようになってからの最高のひとときでした｡ｶｲﾙｱと言う素晴らしい土地での､この素晴らしいﾎｽﾄとの生活は忘れることはできないでしょう｡ｷｯﾁﾝ､ﾘﾋﾞﾝｸﾞは広々と使いやすく､芝生の庭からは優しい日差しが差し込みます｡夜はｶｲﾙｱﾋﾞｰﾁの波音が遠くに聞こえて､満天の星空は快適な眠りに導いてくれます｡ﾜｲｷｷの喧騒から離れた､夢のようなｽﾃｲを提供してくれます｡

It was best time after I came to enjoy a trip in all having a family since I began a trip at Melissa and Frank, the time with two babies. I may not forget the life with this splendid host in splendid land called a kailua. 
It is easy to use a kitchen, the living spaciously, and gentle sunlight comes in through the garden of the lawn.I hear the sound of the waves of the kailua beach in the distance, and the star-filled sky leads it to the comfortable sleep at night. Frank make caipirinha gave relaxation and friendship to travellers from Japan.
I look forward to the day when we meet again to Frank and Melissa.

I loved staying with Melissa and Frank. Did I have any question, Frank would fix it as soon as he could. For travellers without a car and who enjoy to be on bike, it is good to know, that you should rend a bike in advance. M&Fs place is about half an hour walk into town and only a short walk to reach the beach. It is a wonderful quiet place.

Though very brief due to a cancelled flight, we had a great time staying with Melissa and Frank and their two cute little children. They were very welcoming and really seemed to enjoy the  airbnb experience.  What was great was that you could actually have a meaningful conversation with them instead of just quietly stepping around the house. They are really warm and intelligent people. Frank even went out of his way to organize sth for us we needed for our trip. The house had a great vibe, was very clean and beautifully located.  If we were to come to Kailua again, we would surely want to stay with them again!

This is a terrific place to stay, within walking distance (8 minutes) of a good beach for body surfing, or learning to board surf with shore break waves.  This is the same beach the Obama family comes to every xmas.  Frank serves coffee every morning, and greets you as his new friend.

You need transport to get to Kailua, on the Windward side of the island. Once at Frank and Melissa's house, it's @ a mile to Kailua town. Rent a bicycle for $100/week, $20/day, for groceries, and to get to different beach access points, and to Lanikai.

Frank and Melissa are a young couple w/ kids, who really like people, and pay attention to your well being.  They have a functional kitchen, and provide good company,  especially re Brazil.  Always interesting mix of people who come and go.  Thank you Frank and Melissa!  Blow kiss to Alexandra!

We could have not made a better choice than staying with Melissa and Frank. Our little baby had the perfect playmate in their son Kaue. The location - only a short walk away from the beach - is perfect too. Everybody was considerate, friendly and very relaxed. Melissa even drove us to the wedding that we came to Oahu for. Thanks! ;-)

My dad and me enjoyed the time at kailua blue ocean breeze. We think it's a beautiful place to stay and you have many opportunities to go from there. Also the kailua beach is about 10 minutes walk from their house, which is awesome. Melissa and Frank are amazing hosts and we felt really welcome. I would highly recommend to stay with them!

DANGEROUS HOUSE! ! !

When we looked a photo and we corresponded with Melisa thought that we will be in perfect security, but unfortunately everything was here so:
First day. It seems everything was good, really good house and very friendly Melisa, in the evening we got acquainted with her husband (Content removed by Airbnb for violations of Airbnb Review Guidelines - see www.airbnb.com/policies#review_guidelines), he is from Brazil,with hot temperamentю he moved not so long ago  to America.

Melissa and Franck are nice/great host, they have a very nice home and family. I appreciated a lot the neighborhood and it is close to the beach. You can use the kitchen at your convenience.
The bedroom is perfectly clean and comfortable.
They allowed us to rinse off outside in the afternoon we were leaving so that we don't have to travel with salty skin! It was very nice from them.

What a wonderful introduction to airbnb!  We stayed with Melissa and Cabral for five days and we can't say enough good things about this experience. Not only were they extremely warm, kind and helpful, they also have an immaculate house that is in a great community - very safe and only a quick walk to a stunning beach. This provided a great location from which to explore the island and the two of them helped to make this a very memorable stay. They shared a lot of local knowledge with us, lent us their boogie board and even shared some of their amazing cuisine! We would highly recommend their house without any reservations!

Good communication, provided some good restaurants recommendations (For the record, Buzz's steakhouse >>> The grove).
Little contact due to our hectic schedule, but an overall excellent contact. Thanks!

We had a great time with Melissa and Frank! Both gave us a lot of tips for exploring the island and eating out. We joined them in a family and friends barbecue which was a joyful experience. 

They live in a spacious house in a peaceful area. Everything is tidy and clean. It is a short walk to the beach, which is really beautiful.

Truly recommendable!

Melissa and Frank and their two very cute children provide a lovely home to stay in.  It's very spacious, modern and clean.  The short walk to the beach is a great convenience.  There is generous space set aside in the fridge, and also storage space in the bathroom.  The bed is very comfortable and the neighborhood is quiet.  The important part, though, is that the whole family is very warm, caring and welcoming, so that you feel like a friend at once.  The great coffee every morning was also lovely.  I very much agree with all the other glowing reviews (and don't believe a word of the nasty one!  Sorry you had to experience such horrible guests, Melissa and Frank.)

The stay in Kailua Blue Ocean Breeze was awesome.We had a really good time staying in Melissa and Frank's beautiful house. The two are very open, friendly, helpful and can give you good recommendations for eating and exploring the island. We loved the brazilian BBQ we joined one evening :-) 
We really enjoyed our time and would love to come back some time.

Frank and Melissa are wonderful hosts - very warm and helpful.  The house is open and inviting, everything is sparkling clean.  We loved staying there, especially with the close proximity of a gorgeous beach.  Highly recommended!

Frank and Melissa are really nice folks and their house is great. Cute kids too. Everything was meticulously clean and organized. They were very helpful and provided us with a couple of beach towels and shampoo for the shower (we didn't want to carry our own from the mainland). I am a bit picky about clean bathrooms and there was no cause for worry. The bathroom was cleaned daily and was fine. 

Great coffee brewing every morning. We woke to the smell of coffee!

Their house is a 10 minute walk from the beach which was great. Some good restaurants within 5 to 10 mins drive. We particularly liked Rai Rai Ramen. 

Loved Lanikai Beach. Absolutely my favorite. 

Would definitely visit again. 

Michael & Corinne

The atmosphere of Melissa & Franks home is nothing less of wonderful ! Very warm& welcoming,this location is extremely convenient  as it is 3 block walk from the beach and a short distance to  grocery stores such as whole foods and foodland (also lots of restaurants in the area as well) The hosts are extremely knowledgeable about the island and provide great recommendations ! If your looking for a peaceful ,beautiful ,immaculate  home this is it.We are grateful we were able to stay at this location during our time on the island. Many thank yous!
Our stay with Melissa and Frank was lovely. Their house is beautiful and just a short walk to the beach. They are also very helpful answering questions about what to do in Kailua and on Oahu.

What a great place!
Our room was everything we needed to stay. Access to a lovely kitchen and bathroom and a killer patio/backyard to chill in (which also has an aloe vera plant for those who might be burned).
Our stay was comfortable, the place is spotless and a short walk to one of the most beautiful beaches I’ve ever been to my entire life.
Melissa and Frank run and professional and quiet BnB.

It is a beautiful place to stay and walking distance to beach.
I already recommended to my friends and hope to go back again soon.

Melissa and Frank were very accommodating.  Their home is lovely, well equipped for visitors and really close to the beach.  I highly recommend staying here over any place nearby.  They were also very informative when it came to local hikes, events, restaurants and general information.

I absolutely recommend Kailua Blue Ocean Breeze for anyone considering a stay in Kailua.   The Cabral's are a great family, and they have a beautiful home.   I really enjoyed my visit, and would definitely stay here again.
Great place and great hosts. We had a great time and would stay here again. Thanks Melissa and Frank!

To us, this is better than a hotel because of the quality of the people, and the homeyness of their home!  It was multicultural, very elegant, most interesting to talk to them -- overall, couldn't be more inspiring... This was the best B&B experience I will have ever had.  (of course, I love Brazilian people, so it was beyond perfect)  :)
Thank you guys so much!!
Melissa and Frank are great, and their place is beautiful. It's an easy walk from the beach, and their backyard is an ideal place to eat breakfast and plan the day.

Frank and MELISSA was a great host.
When you enter the house, it was very good smell.
It was amazing the room and house is clean.
I also not good at English, and told us to be able to understand.
Even if you do not know that he was saying, he told me that "all right. No problem" with.
I was able to spend a very great day to meet Melissa and Frank.
Thank you so much!!

I stayed with Melissa and Frank and their kids for 4 days and I liked it a lot! They were supernice hosts, always ready to answer all my questions and give me recommendations. Even more, Frank helped me to organize a car! That was awesome!

I also loved the apartment: The rooms were super nicely
decorated  and very clean. The beach of course was awesome too. I can definitely recommend to stay there! I would also highly recommend to rent a car to get around easier, because there's no shops or restaurants in walking distance.

The name kailua ocean breeze describes  as it is. Well-decorated and clean. Easy to get around. The host was really great and willing to give information if you need anything. I highly recommend this place as a spot for you to enjoy real Ohana spirit.

Melissa and Frank are great hosts!  They go out of their way to constantly give you the best advice possible.  Their home is beautiful, the room was great and they have all the things one would need to enjoy his/her/themselves.  I would definitely stay in the Kailua Bay area instead of Wakiki and Melissa and Frank do an excellent job of making you feel welcome!  Thanks guys!
I enjoyed my short stay with Melissa and Frank.  The room was very comfortable and their home warm and inviting. I would stay again if the opportunity arose.

Do not miss the opportunity to spend a great time with this very nice family!
I will recommend to anyone to stay with Cabral and Melissa. 
Take a surf lesson with Cabral, excellent teacher and great memories! 
I will not hesitate to stay with them again if I have the opportunity! 
Go for it! You will not regret it.

Melissa and Frank were very welcoming. Beautiful home and in a great location. My room was bright, clean and spacious and the bathroom was nicely decorated and spotless!

Frank gave me helpful tips on places to visit and lent me one of his surfing boards so that I could get some last minute surfing in.  

Thanks Melissa and Frank for opening up your home to me. I had a wonderful time in Kauai!

All the best,

Natalie
Its a nice place. To stay whit the family was fine. You need a bike or car. Its to far to walk every day in the city. But you can rent beachbikes there.

Melissa and Frank were very helpful and kind during our stay in their home. Had good recommendations for us each day and gave us a nice place to stay. Their home is very cozy and would recommend it any future guests. Mahalo

This time was our first experience to share with owners.

Melissa and Frank showed us great hospitality and we could spend wonderful stay at Kailua.

The house was beautifully comfortable and well organized.

Every morning, we could have a beach morning walk and laid back moment.

At night we viewed fabulous starry night.
Thank you for a wonderful Xmas memory.

Strongly recommend !!

Had and awesome stay at their place. Very close to the beach, did a surfing lesson with Frank, he's a very good surfing instructor, manage to stand on the first go. First time staying with a family bnb, they were very warm and welcoming. Great place to stay.

The best choice for Kailua stay! Melissa & Frank's family is very nice and kind people, we had a very great stay in Kailua.
Frank is actually also a surfing teacher, we tried surfing with him. Great teacher too. The location is few minutes from the beach by car, and also very close from the city center. Very quiet and nice area.

ｶｲﾙｱは宿も少ないようですが､ｶｲﾙｱで泊まるなら最高の宿です｡ﾎｽﾄﾌｧﾐﾘｰはとても親切で､ﾌﾗﾝｸさんは元ｻｰﾌｧｰ､というわけでｻｰﾌｨﾝのｽｸｰﾙもされています｡立地は海からも街からも車で数分の最高の場所にあり､静かで豊かな住宅地の中にあります｡

Melissa and Frank are an international couple, one from Brazil and one from the US, they are world travelers, earth conscious, planners, bright, athletic, attractive, caring parents of two beautiful children, and excellent hosts.
 
Their home is in a quiet residential area, a few blocks walk to the beach, and is inviting, modern, clean, spare and uncluttered, light, open and airy. The upstairs is their personal area and the downstairs with three guest rooms, bathroom, living area and kitchen, and backyard with picnic table, is communal space. This allows the hosts to attend to needs of guests while allowing guests space and also having their own privacy as needed. They have clear house rules to smooth sharing space.
 
They know the area well and have sightseeing and activity suggestions. They are a surfing family. Frank runs a surf school. They know how to make an Airbnb work.
 
We enjoyed our stay very much. We were pleased to get acquainted with our host family. It was also a pleasure to meet the international guests who shared the home with us during our one week stay.

We had a great stay with Melissa and Frank. They have a bunch of guests though which leads to very short kitchen times and complains if you're watching a movie after 10:30 :D
Anyways, a little off from restaurants and markets but overall an awesome family and fun stay

Frank and Melissa were wonderful hosts, they always had great suggestions of places to go and where to eat out. We also loved Kailua with its beautiful beaches and laid back locals, so much better than Waikiki! If you get the chance I would definitely take a surfing lesson with Frank. He is an expert surfer and a great instructor. His class incorporates balance and strength building techniques that would be great for any level of surfer. He helped both my husband and I stand up on our first lesson! Sad to be back in Seattle after such a wonderful Hawaiian vacation!

ED AND I HAD A WONDERFUL TIME WITH MELISSA AND FRANK AND THEIR TWO BEAUTIFUL CHILDREN IN HAWAII.  THEY WERE VERY KIND AND CARING HOSTS AND WENT OUT OF THEIR WAY TO HELP US ENJOY OUR HOLIDAY.
THE BEAUTIFUL HOME HAD ALL AMENITIES  WE NEEDED AND I WOULD LOVE TO STAY THERE AGAIN ONE DAY.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED TO ANYONE THINKING OF GOING TO HAWAII.
ED AND JOSEPHINE, PERTH, AUSTRALIA.
We had a lovely stay. The area is nice an quied, the beaches very near and in kailua center enough possabilities to eat. frank was allways very friendly and helpfully. We would come again!
A must stay in this beautiful place.

We've had a wonderful stay in Kailua! Frank gave us a warm welcome and an unforgettable surfing-lesson. We've met very lovely persons from Germany, Australia and the US during our stay at Franks and Melissas house. Thanks for all those great recommendations you gave us! We'll be back, for sure. Mahalo!

My sister and I loved staying with Frank and Melissa!! Their family and home are so lovely and they gave us amazing recommendations every day. We definitely would not have had such a wonderful Oahu experience without them. Definitely stay here, and we will be back whenever we are in Oahu! We also took a surf lesson with Frank, and both of us stood up on our first day. You should give it a try, he's a great teacher! Kailua is a great area - most beautiful beaches, close to awesome hikes, good food, and not a far drive from the north shore or anywhere on the island.

I loved that the house was in a quiet, residential neighborhood.  The house was very nice and very clean.  I enjoyed reading the daily board with the quote of the day and ideas for the day (whether it was a hiking trail or a great restaurant to try).  Frank was a great surfing instructor.  I appreciated that he did the "warm up" before the actual lessons to get my muscles warmed up first.  It's a safe place for single women and I really enjoyed meeting the other guests that came to stay when I was there. Melissa was very compassionate and caring and gave me some good tips.

Hi Guys. This was my first Airbnb booking and it was terrific! I had the pleasure of staying with @ Melissa & Franks for 8 days. It was perfect! Clean, quiet & near the beautiful beaches Kailua. I would definitely recommend staying with them. We actually booked two private rooms- Both which were perfect.  I plan on coming back to Hawaii in the next month and will be using their place again. Thanks gain for everything!

Melissa and Frank were great! They also offered a 2014 Hyundai rental car for a small additional cost.  I was picked up and dropped off at the airport as well. The house was perfect for all my needs. The bedroom was clean, comfortable and spacious. It also had a small size refrigerator which was convenient! The lanai and open air dining was awesome! Melissa also puts up a quote of the day and a fun idea for adventure, farmers market, water kayaking,etc.  great neighborhood very close to Kailua Beach, Lanikai, and shopping and restaurants!

Staying with Melissa and Frank was really wonderful. Their home is light, comfortable and welcoming and really well designed to have people stay. As hosts they were available to give suggestions about things to do and places to see and both were incredibly helpful. Kailua itself is gorgeous and the house is in easy distance to gorgeous beaches, hikes and shops. I hope to come back and stay again!

We had a great time staying at Frank and Melissa's. We didn't realise that there would be other airbnb guests staying there but we hardly saw them. They have a lovely back yard and outdoor seating area in which we loved having our meals. Our bedroom was clean and cosy and we had a cooler AND a fan which was great for those hot nights. The bathroom was spotless despite us sharing it with other guests. They are a few blocks to the beach (and a stunning beach at that!) and live in a lovely quiet neighbourhood with views to the mountains. The only downside is that they're not near any food outlets or cafes (nearest one is a fair distance - about 20-25 mins walk) but they also hire bikes so we did this and went to the nearby Wholefoods quite regularly to get food. Would go back and stay there again.

Melissa and Frank are very friendly and helpful. I am so glad we stayed at their place.
Their house is very clean, beautiful and quiet. The rooms are nice, got a beautiful garden and most of all, they got a beautiful family which brought smiles to our faces many many times during our short stay.
The house is very close to the local beach. You can also rent a bike and we went everywhere with it. 
We totally enjoyed staying at their place and and we would definitely come back here again.

Melissa and Frank are awesome hosts. They gave me great recommendations of must-do activities in Kailua (farmers market, hiking trails etc) and I fully enjoyed the stay. The room is super clean and well decorated. There was a little miscommunication on what time I was arriving, but they were responsive and I did not wait long to get into the house.

My boyfriend and I really enjoyed our stay at Melissa and Cabral's house. They made us feel very welcome. The house is big and has a lot of space to relax in the backyard. Our room was clean and very accomodating. They let us borrow their surf boards, snorkeling equipment, beach chairs and more to take with us if we wanted to. That was very nice of them. They also hosted a barbecue one night for me and two other guest since it was our birthdays, we really appreciated that. Since we rented their car, Cabral picked us up at the airport even though our flight was delayed 6 hrs. He dropped us, too. That was very helpful.
Overall our experience at their place was very pleasant and forgot to mention very close to the beach that we liked the most, Lanikai beach. If we go back to Oahu we would definitely like to stay at their house again.

Thank you Melissa and Cabral

The house is open allowing air to flow through from the nice backyard which is helpful in the summer heat. Fresh columbian coffee every morning was a nice touch. The hosts Frank and Melissa were great to talk too. Frank was a star, as he took me to the airport then we discovered I had left my drivers license back at the house. Frank raced back to get it as I needed it for the Maui trip rental car.  He saved my Maui experience. Their children are so cute and quiet. The room had two fans in it to keep me cool. Nice quiet neighbourhood with the bus stop 2 blocks away.
clean - helpful - nice car for a good rental price

We were extremely satisfied and happy with our stay at Melissa & Frank's house. The location could not be better, close to the beautiful beach of Kailua and close to restaurants and grocery stores as well - in fact a target will be opening soon 5 min from their house. The house is very clean, cozy and the room very private. The hosts are just very nice, Cabral is very helpful, always very polite and kind. Melissa gave us some good tips and she is super sweet! They both know a lot in there so having their guidance in what to do, where to go... made a tremendous difference in our vacation...  They are fantastic! They even have a board in the kitchen with sunset and sunrise times :) 
Besides that, I must say... We were told by a friend that lived in Hawaii - you need a car to actually know the island. Do rent a car!

Frank and Melissa were wonderful! The room and their home was SPOTLESS!  The dining area that opened onto the backyard was my favorite part of the home and it was lovely to wake up to such a green and inviting space every morning. Frank had lovely advise for things to see and do in the neighborhood every day. I love their daily board with times of sunrise and sunset, and a great quote every morning! I could not have had a better place to stay in Kailua! Thank you guys for having me!!!

I only met Melissa for a few minutes when I arrived and we didnt have much time to chat as it was already very late. However, I had some nice chat with Frank and he is a really nice guy and gives good advices on what do to....
The house is really clean and in a nice neighbourhood. Everything is absolutely perfect and I had a great stay! Would I go there again? YES!

My wife and I went to Hawaii for our vacation and took the opportunity to find a cozy spot to stay through airbnb and we got a great deal! Since we had a tight schedule to follow for our trip, we had to request a late check in and Melissa was more than happy to accomodate. Check in was very easy and Melissa took the time to show us around and walk us through the place and it is gorgeous! The location of the house is very close to beach and they were nice enough to let us borrow their towels as well as snorkeling gear if needed! The room is very large and faces the outside and you have a clear view of the mountains from the room! 
We both loved our stay and couldnt have been happier! If we ever are traveling back to Kailua we will definitely look up the place again! A great airbnb host!

I enjoyed my stay in their nice and clean home very much. I mostly talked to Cabral and he gave me a lot of recommendations where to go and what to see. I even took a surf lesson with him - he is a great host and teacher. 
I'd definitely stay there again. 
Mahalo!

Melissa and Cabral were very nice and accommodating.  Coffee every morning, nice clean space, and Kailua beach within walking distance (about a 10 min. walk).  Shared bathroom was done well with a shelf for each room to store their things out of the way and a towel rack in each room.   They had plenty or books to help with site seeing and made some recommendations too.  The room was nice and bright, although if you like it dark when you sleep you may want to book one of their other rooms.  Small fridge in the room was really nice too.  Would be happy to book with them again in the future.

M&F's place is clean and shinny. The living room is large and open. Cabral was very friendly and helpful. He gave us an orientation around the house on our arrival. We were allowed to borrow their snorkeling gear and body board and there is even a hot shower in the back yard. The parking was easy. I had the opportunity to meet Melissa's parents, they are both very nice people. Although we had to share bathroom with other guests, the bathroom is very clean. If I have to say a negative thing, it might not be ideal if you are on honeymoon or looking for quietness and privacy. But if you want to meet people and make friends, this is a good option.

Melissa and Frank's home in Kailua was absolutely wonderful! We were checked in by their assistant who was very helpful and friendly. The first thing you will notice is how open and clean their house is. Like most homes in Hawaii the "no shoes" policy in the house keeps everything very clean which was refreshing. 

The room we stayed in was nicely  designed and extremely clean. At the foot of the bed they have an ottoman that has bath and beach towels to use. A small fridge is in the room for food also. 

They openly offer snorkel gear, body boards and various  beach equipment free of charge, and invite you to email them about renting the foam longboards in the backyard.

Overall, our three night stay at Melissa and Frank's was an incredible experience! If you are considering staying in Kailua I strongly recommend staying here!

Our week stay in one of Melissa and Cabral's rooms was lovely. The house is well set up with plenty of common space for guests including a large back yard. They mostly use the upstairs so we were able to use the lounge and dining area at our leisure, however the kitchen is not overly for guest use.
The location is fantastic for the beach - an 8 minute walk - and is set in a very quiet and safe neighbourhood. We didn't have a car and walking to town takes a good 25minutes - great exercise! - but if you want to be near restaurants/shops, you'd be better off staying closer to Kailua Beach Park.

The downsides are the thin doors on the rooms which can make it noisy, and one bathroom for up to 6 people. Mostly these things were not an issue and we didn't have to wait.

We took advantage of their airport pick up/drop off (included with a 2-day car rental) and this was a great help. Melissa and Cabral were kind enough to accommodate our early arrival and late flight out.
Thanks!

Frank and Melissa were great hosts. Their house is beautiful and quiet, and very close to the beach! I didn't spend a lot of time because I was visiting friends and family on the island, but this is a great spot in Kailua if you're traveling by yourself!

My partner and I stayed for four days in Melissa and Cabral’s home and we thought it was beautiful. The house is shared with the hosts, their two young kids (very respectful and super cute), and their assistant Jo, who is around once in awhile and picked us up from the airport. Bright, spacious and clean, it was conveniently located to some of the most beautiful white sand/turquoise beaches (Lanikai) and was a short trip to the North shore and Honolulu. The hosts were very attentive to us, making sure to give us recommendations and had coffee/tea and oatmeal packets available for breakfast. There is a small bar fridge in the room and suited our needs to store our food/snacks over the next few days. Beach chairs, snorkel gear and boogie boards were available too! We took them up on their offer to rent the car, which was very convenient and Cabral dropped us back off at the airport even though it was pass checkout and was quite late. We even tried to get a surfing lesson but the ocean didn’t cooperate. We’ll be back for that surfing lesson, Cabral! Mahalo to you and your family!

The best house at the best place! Kailua is just amazing, and Melissa and Frank's house is the perfect place to stay. Clean and very confortable, the hosts make everything to make sure that you  feel at home. I would definitely stay there again,
Thank you Frank and Melissa!
Gus and Pati

Lovely room in beautiful, open airy house. Fantastic Island feel! Melissa and Cabral were warm and wonderful hosts with the perfect balance of friendliness, while giving you plenty of space to be in your own world. They were incredibly kind, gracious, and helpful, truly they could not have been more perfect hosts! The impeccably clean room has two windows and a ceiling fan so it was always the perfect temperature. The bed was very comfortable and I sleep soundly every night! Plenty of closet and bureau space should you need it and you even have a mini refrigerator in the room. Great beach towels, chairs, boogie boards, and other beach accoutrements are available for your use. Cabral even offers surf lessons! I also LOVED the activity board that has an inspirational quote for the day, a recommended activity (which seems thoughtfully chosen given weather conditions and time of year), and a suggestion for a place to eat. Fantastic hospitality, a charming and comfortable room --   Kailua Blue Ocean Breeze is a great value, lovely place to stay, and you could not find better hosts! Maholo Melissa and Cabral

Great neighborhood for getting around on bike; near bus line. Hosts had coffee ready in a.m. no matter how early i left. I appreciated the in-room frig  and their letting me watch their t.v. for a few favorite programs. I would stay there  again should I get back to kailua.  Their kids made me feel part of the family too. Thanks for a great visit! N

A wonderful place! Everything is very clean and nice - we really enjoyed the stay there. Its just a 10min walk to the nearest beach or a 5-10min drive to the famous lanikai beach. Kailua is a good place to explore the whole island. We definitely would recommend to stay there :)

Melissa, Frank and their two children shared their warm and wonderful smiles. They are an easy going family with a clean and uncluttered house and nice neighborhood. It was nice to use the kitchen for quick meals/snacks and then eat in the beautiful yard. Late in the morning I enjoyed hearing their children quietly play as well as hearing the neighbors young kids in the adjacent house. Yet often it felt as if we had the house to ourselves (the kitchen,living, dinning, yard).  They let their house "breathe"- open windows for the wonderful fresh Hawaiian air. The location makes it easy to travel by car or the Bus. Lastly, the beach closest to the house was the least crowded beach on the whole island!

the place is like exactly like picture! Very clean and comfortable ,very beautiful! And the host they are super nice people! I'm so glad I chooses them, I have very good experience at there house, I defiantly recommend this place to u!
So great to be back. It was 3rd time for me to stay with Melissa and Frank
Great place to stay! Melissa and Frank are very friendly hosts and the house was clean and comfortable.

We had a great time in Kailua! Cabral and Melissa's place is amazing and they are super nice people. If you want to escape from busy Waikiki and stay close to the beach in a cool city, that's the place for you!
Melissa and Frank were wonderful hosts. Thank you!

STAY HERE FOR A GREAT STAY IN KAILUA!  Honestly Melissa and Frank were the best hosts that we could have ever asked for. During our stay we felted like welcome guests in their spacious home. We only saw Frank and Melissa a handful of times, but when we did they were both eager to hear about our trip as well as give some recommendations as to what we might like to do. Their house has a nice open concept with wide open doors out towards the backyard letting in the warm ocean breeze :) They offered us use of their  personal beach chairs, coolers, towels, boogie board and umbrella (this was a game changer on those warm beach days) The house never felt crowded as people came and went. Every morning we were greeted with a fresh pot of coffee and a "recommendation of the day". We didn't do everything that they suggested, but the things we did do were awesome. The Thursday night market in Kailua is a must BTW! Their kids are a delight and were so cute and even got to know our names :) A few other amenities worth mentioning is: use of their fully stocked kitchen(perfect for that quick breakfast after a trip to Whole Foods Market), clean bathroom with shampoo, conditioner, and body wash, easy access to parking (we rented a car), close to nearby shopping (Target, Whole Foods, Macys, Longs Drugs, Gas Stations, etc... as well as only a quick walk or drive to the beach, convenient feet rinsing station in the back of the house for getting rid of the sand on your feet. 

All in all I would give this Airbnb a 5/5. Thank you Frank and Melissa for making our stay special!

This was my first time using Airbnb. Melissa and Frank were very welcoming and their communication prior to our arrival was great. Frank greeted us and showed us around their lovely property. It is just like the photos that I saw. Everything was very clean and organized. There was a board with little thoughts for the day and tips about places to see. I felt very safe staying there on my own. The neighborhood was very quiet. Kailua is a fantastic area with great shops and restaurants and amazing beaches!
We really enjoyed our stay at Melissa and Frank's house. Super-nice family, beautiful room, safe neighbourhood! We always would come back!!!

Cabral and Melissa's home was lovely. The first floor of the home has 3 rental rooms, which all share a bathroom. This space is very open, airy, and exceedingly clean. They have a lush, fenced backyard with patio furniture and a drying rack for beach towels and swimsuits. The neighborhood is residential and quiet. Kailua itself has a small-town, low-key vibe. We had a rental car and could easily access the beach. Cabral posts a "Recommendation of the Day" which led us to the Kailua Farmers Market, a highlight of our trip. With the other guests and the hosts' children floating around, it really feels like a family-friendly, Hawaiian-style hostel.

Lovely Accommodation, Close to the beach and shops.

Melissa and Frank were lovely to deal with, not intrusive but full of suggestions and loved the Daily suggestions.

Very Easy to deal with, great room with Wifi and fantastic coffee in the mornings

私たちにとって初めてのairbnbでしたが､とても素晴らしいﾎｽﾄとお家でくつろいで過ごすことができました｡
お家はとても静かで清潔で､お庭も広く色とりどりのお花があって､そこでﾗﾝﾁしたり夜に星を眺めたりするのが大好きでした｡
自転車もお店よりも安くﾚﾝﾀﾙさせてくれるので､ｶｲﾙｱﾋﾞｰﾁやﾗﾆｶｲﾋﾞｰﾁ､街まですぐ行くことができました｡
また､ﾎｽﾄの家族もとっても素敵な方々でした!
CabralとMelissaは心優しい〜お二人で､私たちが英語がつたなくても､一生懸命聞いてくれて､色んな旅のｱﾄﾞﾊﾞｲｽもくれました｡
帰りの空港まで､送ってくれました
2人の子供達もたまらなくかわいい!
ｶｲﾙｱに暮らしているかのように旅ができるのがとても素敵でした｡
またｶｲﾙｱにくるときは､このお家に泊まりたいです｡


This is our first time staying at Airbnb.
It was so great time and so comfortable.
The house is calm, clean, also they have wonderful yard.
We love to have breakfast, looking stars at yard.
We barrow beach bicycle from they,so we can go to beach so easily.
Cabral and Melissa is sooo nice people.
And their kids is so adorable!! 

Even we can't speak english well, they tried to understand about what we want to know.
And gave us ideas to have fun at Kailua.
And Rebecca drove us to airport!
We had big suitcases so we couldn't ride the bus, it helps us.
We could staying like living, we were so happy.
We want to stay if we come back here.
Thank you Melissa and Cabral!

For kindly giving I was able to travel comfortably in caring. I could not go to sleep posts unfortunate part. Personal refrigerator was useful. I was traveling with my son Thank you for letting me share a toy.

It was nice to meet Cabral and Melissa, and of course their kids, too!
They are such a cute family.
When I arrived, Cabral gave me a short guide to their home. Everything was absolutely clean in the house! The bathroom, the kitchen, the living room, my room. I loved my room, it was exactly as in the pictures... even better! I felt like at home.
A really nice gesture was the daily recommendation on their board in the kitchen. 
The only thing which was I was a bit sad about was the checking out. I sad I would like to leave at 9 a.m. but Melissa and Cabral weren't home, unfortunately. But I really wanted to say thank you for everything and for the nice accomondation, personally to them.

It is a perfect stay in Kailua, but I would really recommend to rent a car while staying here, because the distances are a bit long (to Kailua Beach Park, Lanikai, Shops, ...)

Thank you Melissa and Cabral!

ｶｲﾙｱでの滞在は初めてでしたが素晴らしい滞在でした｡
辺りはとても静かで､毎朝鳥のさえずりで目が覚めました｡
うちの中はどこも明るく清潔で､とても趣味の良い調度品が並べられています｡

MelissaとFrankはとても人柄が良く､Frankが2人の可愛い子供達を優しく世話をする姿と､Melissa優しい笑顔が印象的でした｡
Frankの妹のJoも私達にとても優しくしてくれました｡

滞在中､色んな国の人たちにも出会えて貴重な滞在になりました｡

Melissa､Frank､Jo  本当にありがとう｡

Wir sind spät abends in Hawaii angekommen und mit dem Taxi (Ca. 70$) nach Kailua gefahren. Melissa und Frank haben das Haus offen gelassen und in unserem Zimmer fanden wir Schlüssel, Internet Passwort, Handtücher und weitere Infos. Das Zimmer& Bad  ist super schön und sauber. Das Haus liegt in einem ruhigen Wohngebiet und wir haben die Fahrräder gemietet, was sehr hilfreich ist. Als Transportmittel benötigt man entweder Fahrrad und Bus (man darf die Fahrräder mit im Bus transportieren) oder ein Auto! Der Stand und Kailua Stadt sind ruhig und wundervoll. Wir haben außerdem Surf Unterricht bei Frank genommen und hatten jede Menge Spaß dabei.
Melissa and Cabral have a great home with convenient access to the beach. Their recommendations for activities were helpful and the surfing lesson was a nice add-on.

初めてのairbnbで心配もありましたが､短い滞在期間を心地よく過ごせる心遣いが沢山散りばめられて､とっても満足でした｡部屋も綺麗で凄く広いし､他の滞在者ももんな素敵でﾌﾚﾝﾄﾞﾘｰでした!自転車をかりたらﾊﾟﾝｸしている､というﾊﾌﾟﾆﾝｸﾞはあったものの､有名なﾋﾞｰﾁへ必ず入る為のｺﾂや､友達が日焼けし過ぎた際にはｱﾛｴｸﾘｰﾑをくれたりと､本当に助かりました｡かわいいkidsもいて､癒されます｡ぜひｵｽｽﾒの滞在先です!


This was the first time for us to use airbnb and we were kind of nervous, but it wasn't necessary. Melissa, Frank and little two kids were so kind, friendly and nice to us and their Aloha mind made me relax and we had an amazing time there. I loved their " today's recommendation". It's on the board in the living room and they chose today's words and cool event. It also posted sunset/sunrise, so you'll know what time you should be at the beach! Other guests were so great too, and it was so easy to exchange our experiences at the kitchen. The house is huge, room and both room are clean and great taste of furnish. Highly recommend for your choice in Hawaii!!!

We had a great stay at Melissa and Cabral's place. 
The bedroom was spacious and the additional fans on both bedsides were great amenities. 
Shared bathroom was neat and cleaned daily.
We also loved that board with daily activity recommendations.
All in all: Thank you for your hospitality!

初めてのAirbnbで心配もありましたが､非常に楽しくStayさせて頂きました｡
ﾎｰﾙﾌｰｽﾞなどｶｲﾙｱの町中心まで車で5-10分､海まで徒歩圏内と､ｶｲﾙｱを中心にする拠点としては絶好の立地｡
また､治安の良い住宅街だったので､安心してStayできました｡
基本的なｱﾒﾆﾃｨは揃っており､部屋は非常に綺麗で快適に過ごすこともできました｡
風通しの良いﾊﾜｲらしい建物で､Local Hawaiiの生活が十分に楽しめます｡
なによりもMellisaはじめﾎｽﾄが非常に気さくで､親切で助かりました｡
次に行くときは足を治して､ｻｰﾌｨﾝを習いに行きたいです｡

Thank you for your hospitality and sharing us your wonderful place!!!!
This was the first time for us to use airbnb and we were a little bit nervous, but we were able to make ourselves at home right after Cabral welcomed us into their house.
Melissa and Cabral were friendly, kind and nice person to have a little chat with. 
It took only 5-10 min by car from the house to Kailua town, where you can shop and dine, and was pretty close to the beach. It was a perfect location to enjoy Kailua.
The bedroom and shared bathroom were clean and neat with nice amenities. 
We loved their airy and Hawaiian style house with open living to the nice back yard, we were able to stay as we were living in Hawaii at the moment.
We will definitely like to come back and hopefully, we would like to learn surfing at the beautiful sea next time.

This house is very beautiful and within walking distance of the beach. The pictures match exactly how things look. Kailua is a great place. A little more quiet and tucked away, but close enough to things to do (for most of them though we suggest renting a car). The bathroom is shared with two other guest rooms. It is kept very clean but from time to time can be a bit of a line to get to. Melissa and Frank were friendly people and provided some great suggestions. To be honest, there were a few times where we did not feel as welcome as we have at other Airbnb places. The house and all the guests really did keep among themselves which may work great for some folks.

Very nice place, near the beach, big room and toilet was to sharr with other guests but everything clean and tidy. 
Nice option to move around Oahu or just lie down in Kailua beach.
Thanks guys!
Information of the room was exactly like mentioned, Frank and Melissa were super friendly and always gave tips what to Do on the Island. It was possible to get beachchairs and snorkling equipment.

I had a pleasant stay at Melissa and Cabral's.

They are nice people and very helpful in every way.

Cabral installed a basket for my bike right away when I asked. Full of Aloha spirit!

They are located in a very safe, quiet area, 15minutes bike ride from center of Kailua or from beach.

It was convenient to rent a bike from them, for $15 a day. Cabral provided an airport transportation for $90 round trip, too, there was no need for me to rent a car.

Bedroom and shared bathroom were beautiful and clean.

I recommend them highly.
Very friendly. Cabral gave us a lot of tips and Melissa made us feel very welcomed.

The house is well equipped, confortable and located in a quiet neighborhood a few blocks away from Kailua beach. I rented a bike offered by Cabral and that was very useful. Kailua and Lanikai are very beautiful beaches, and on a sunny day I felt blessed for being there, as well as when I watched the fantastic sunset from the top of Lanikai Pillboxes Trail, which was a program suggested by Cabral. I would stay there again and I will recommend it to my friends who ask me about it.

Recentemente me hospedei na Casa do Cabral e da Melissa por duas noites e foi uma ótima experiência. A casa é bem equipada, confortável e localizada em uma vizinhança tranquila, a poucas quadras das areias da praia de Kailua. Aluguei uma bicicleta oferecida pelo Cabral, a qual foi muito útil. Kailua e Lanikai são praias muito bonitas, e em um dia ensolarado senti-me abençoado por estar lá, assim como por ter assistido a um pôr-do-sol fantástico do topo da trilha de Lanikai Pillboxes, programa sugerido pelo Cabral. 
Certamente me hospedaria lá novamente e recomendarei a amigos que venham a me perguntar a respeito.

Cabral and Melissa were wonderful hosts. They were very prompt in all communication and Cabral provided a very good overview when my sister and I checked in. We really loved the recommendations he gave us. The location is truly wonderful and if we go back to Oahu we would definitely stay in Kailua again.

The room's door is a slatted one, so sound carries very easily throughout the house. Didn't impact our stay but would have appreciated knowing beforehand. Would suggest bringing your own towel if not difficult and you are staying more than a few days (they provided a personal towel set for each of us and beach towels). There is plenty of closet and drawer space, a white noise machine and fans, and a mini fridge in the room. There's also space in the bathroom's linen closet to store toiletries.

Overall, we had a great stay and would recommend. We miss Kailua already!

Melissa, Frank, and their adorable kids are very warm hosts! The bedroom is exactly as shown in photos and very clean. We were provided with a balanced amount of privacy and assistance, thank you for a lovely time in Oahu!

A nossa estadia no local foi maravilhosa! Melissa e Cabral foram muito simpáticos e atenciosos durante todo o período que estivemos em sua casa. Emprestaram cadeiras de praia e equipamento de Snorkel, e nos deram orientações sobre praias e locais interessantes para visitar! O quarto é bastante confortável e a localização da casa é ótima. Foi uma excelente experiência. Além disso, a praia de Kailua é uma das mais lindas do Havaí.

I had a great time in Kaului. Cabral and Melisa were so kind, and house was clean. And rental car is available. There are Body boards, beach chairs, beach towels. It's very useful. And location is perfect.

Melissa and Frank are awesome!  The location is close to the beach and not far from shopping and restaurants. The room was comfortable. Melissa and Frank were so helpful in helping us decide our daily activities. definitely recommend this booking. Aloha.
We had a great time staying with Melissa and Frank. Thank you!

Melissa and Cabral were great hosts. I felt welcomed as soon as I arrived. The room was clean and organized and the shared bathroom was well maintained. The mini fridge in the room was a nice bonus as well. As another reviewer mentioned the door to your room is slatted so unfortunately this means sound travels fairly easily to/from the living room and kitchen. But that was the only minor issue throughout my entire stay. I highly recommend this place for the great location (neighborhood and proximity to the beach) and the hosts!

Frank and Melissa's place is a very cozy home tucked away in a beautiful town called Kailua... All restaurants are close by and the beach is just 8 mins walk... The good thing is they have boards, snorkel equipment, beach umbrellas and chairs that you can borrow which saves a lot of trouble of renting from the beach...The room was nice with 2 bed side fans in addition to the ceiling fan which really helps in summers although it wasn't too hot when we visited...Just had 2 small hiccups... We had damp towels which didn't smell good which was fixed by the hosts... I am not sure if anything about breakfast was mentioned anywhere in the listing but some light breakfast provided would've been nice.. Overall pleasant stay!!!
Loved the lotus pond at Willa's house. Many beautiful tree and flowers.

My stay at Kailua Blue Ocean Breeze was wonderful! It was like a home away from home. I felt welcome immediately and It was evident as soon as I walked into the house that Melissa and Cabral take great pride in making your stay was comfortable as possible. My room was perfect for my stay. The mini fridge was handy. Any place/restaurant  they recommended to me was amazing. The Lemon Grass Thai restaurant was to die for! Thanks again for a wonderful experience. I can't wait to visit Kailua again!

I stayed at Melissas and Cabrals place for three nights and I loved it! It has been the nicest Airbnb room I've ever been to :) I didn't wanna leave. Not only because of the room (which was very nicely done up and has had everything I needed and more) but the area (Kailua is paradise!) and the people. I felt home as soon as I walked in and felt part of the family. They looked after me VERY well and did more necessary. Had a short but amazing time. Would definitly come back!
The welcome was friendly and Everything as described.

Melissa und Frank waren nette, freundliche Gastgeber. Ihr Haus ist modern und gemütlich. Das mit anderen Gästen geteilte Badezimmer war immer ordentlich.
Wir hatten eine schöne Zeit in kailua, der Strand ist zu Fuss erreichbar. Allerdings ist ein Mietauto vonVorteil, wenn man die Insel erkunden 
will.

Great place. Clean, quiet and close to walk to the beach and town. Nice neighborhood. Really enjoyed my time in Kailua. Didn't get a chance to meet them in person but their assistant was great! Great little car they have to rent and very reasonable rental rate. 
Mahalo

Melissa, Cabral, and their two adorable kids allowed me to stay with them in their house about half a mile from the beach. Melissa gave tips and suggestions each day for things to do, and was very welcoming. Everything was as described in their Airbnb profile, although there was quite a bit of mold on the fan immediately above my bed. I just didn't use the fan or turn the main light on (turning the light on automatically turned the fan on). Aside from that, the place was clean, the location (near the beach) was perfect, and I felt very safe walking in the area around their home-even at night!

Arriving at Melissa's and Cabral's we were given a very warm welcoming in a really great home the two shared with us. We had a fabulous room, and especially enjoyed the possibility to sit in the garden and enjoy coffee and chat a bit. Melissa and Cabral are very forthcoming with suggestions what to do, which restaurant  to eat at and recommendations to explore the island. Though not really a requirement but I have to tell as I loved it - the mint and herb shampoo and conditioner provided in the bathroom during our stay were fantastic and exactly what a girl needs! All in all a great family to stay with you feel at home within seconds of arrival!

Experience was great! Everything was just as described. The family was very friendly and inviting. We had a great time getting to know them and even took a surfing lesson with Frank "Cabral". They were really flexible on our checkout even though we were past a couple hours. They had great suggestions for daily activities, restaurants, and some very encouraging daily verses on the whiteboard. I would recommend to anyone that they stay with Melissa and Cabral. They're moving in a few days to an even nice home! So we're going to have to go back and check it out! 
-Rudi and Snowee

Melissa and Frank were extremely welcoming when my friend and I first arrived to the house. They made us feel right at home and were very helpful with all of our questions. They even provided us with beach towels, chairs, and allowed us to use their snorkel equipment during the day. The house was beautiful and very clean. I loved that in Hawaiian culture people leave their doors unlocked. I felt very safe and I know all my belonging were safe as well. Melissa and Frank even posted daily recommendations and quotes at the house which was so thoughtful of them! I loved that they even posted the times of the sunrise and sunsets. It influenced the times of the day my friend and I did certain hikes. Overall great experience!

Melissa and Cabral were in the process of moving home when I stayed in Kailua so it was a bit of a special time and I understand they were a bit busier than usual.. Nevertheless Melissa was very kind and helpful to me and the room was clean and very close to the beach, with a nice garden and some tea or coffee available, can't complain!

Really nice, stylish, modern and clean house. Room was big enough, neat and tidy. Although it was sometimes too hot in the bedroom, even the fan didn't help much. Family was friendly and very helpful, they offered us to use their snorkelling sets, beach chairs etc.

Seriously such a great experience, my girlfriend and I have traveled all over using Airbnb and this was by far one of the best finds. It is in such a great location away from the big touristy spots but not to far away if you wanted to go back to Honolulu. You will have an amazing experience and be able to see a lot more of the island than anyone who is staying on Wakiki

I don't even know where to start.  This was our first trip to HI and our first Airbnb experience.  I have absolutely nothing negative to say about either. Cabral and Melissa are absolutely wonderful.  Thier home is beautiful, the room was perfect and they were very hospitable.  We loved being just a short walk from the beach and not having to deal with it being so crowed.  Kailua is a great little place far enough away from the craziness of crowds and just a short drive away from most of the popular attractions. We hope to visit again and when we do we will be staying here. thank you for a great week!

Listing was as described. Spot clean and even though it was hot and humid outside the fans were more than enough to keep the room fresh. 

Little far (30 min walking distance) from town and (30 in drive) Honolulu but bus was close by. Expect to spend a lot of time on public transportation.

Not much interaction because we weren't around as much but overall really nice. Check-out was too early for us as our flight was at night, therefore not very convenient.

Beach is definitely one of the best in town!! Bring some food and water

Melissa and her family were just amazing hosts and so helpful with advice about Kailua.  Their home was so close to the beach, and Kailua was just awesome to visit.  The room and bathroom seemed like it was out of a movie with how clean, modern, and homely it was.  I would definitely stay here again.

Melissa and Cabrel were wonderful hosts and made us feel welcome in their home. The location is perfect for beach goers as it is walking distance to Kailua beach and a short drive to Lanikai beach. The entire house and property is very clean. You are welcome to use their pool and beach equipment. Coffee and fruit are always offered throughout the day. Our room share the bathroom with another room but this was never a problem. They have 2 beautiful well behaved children that love to keep active so at times we felt as if we had the house to ourselves. We would definitely recommend their place if you are planning a trip to Kailua.

Nice room in a nice house. It's a 5 minute walk from the beach, and about a 15-20 minute walk from 'downtown' Kailua. Hosts were very friendly--offered fruit and coffee in the morning, and helped me decide which hikes to try.

Cabral and Melissa were amazing hosts; they were very sweet and always made sure we settled in well. We felt very comfortable staying here as they made us feel welcomed. The house is beautiful and spacious. It is also located very near the beach and is in close proximity to eateries which made mealtimes easy. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a cosy spot to call "home" for a few days.

Hello Airbnbers! 
I spent the weekend for 2 nights with Melissa and Cabral. The location is prime located on the more relaxed, quieter side of the island. Everything for basic necessities like groceries, restaurants, and convenience items are a quick 5 minute drive casually cruising the Kailua neighborhoods. The beach is the big draw and they were helpful pointing me to the residential access points so parking was a breeze and the beach much less crowded! 
Couple things to note: Room is only cooled down with a tower fan and open window for air circulation. I would say it felt 10-15 warmer in the room than outside. I come from San Francisco where it's cooler but nonetheless it didn't take much to break a sweat. I slept with no blankets and the fan directly on me all night. 
The other item to note is the shower head sits at about 5'6 and is mounted to the side wall. Being 6'3 it at least made me say a few extra prayers while getting myself clean! (aka I had to duck down or go on my knees) 

All in all great people, great location, at a great price compared to getting s hotel! I really enjoyed this calmer side of the island and found myself interacting with way more native islanders who enthusiastically shared their insights about great places to hike, surf, and beach all over the island. 
Thanks again for being great hosts! 
-Tim

Maison très sympa, on s'y sent tout de suite bien, tout est impeccable. L'idéal est d'avoir un moyen de locomotion pour aller dans le centre ville (vélo ou voiture) mais faisable à pieds. Les plages aux alentours sont superbes. Bon spot sur Oahu.
Very welcoming and friendly family
